segment.source: Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources (Windows 10)
segment.target: Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources (Windows 10)

segment.source: Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources
segment.target: Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources

segment.source: Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources
segment.target: Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: The use of authentication in the previously described goal (Restrict Access to Only Trusted Devices) enables a device in the isolated domain to block traffic from untrusted devices.
segment.target: The use of authentication in the previously described goal (Restrict Access to Only Trusted Devices) enables a device in the isolated domain to block traffic from untrusted devices.

segment.source: However, it does not prevent an untrusted device from eavesdropping on the network traffic shared between two trusted devices, because by default network packets are not encrypted.
segment.target: However, it does not prevent an untrusted device from eavesdropping on the network traffic shared between two trusted devices, because by default network packets are not encrypted.

segment.source: For devices that share sensitive information over the network, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security allows you to require that all such network traffic be encrypted.
segment.target: For devices that share sensitive information over the network, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security allows you to require that all such network traffic be encrypted.

segment.source: Using encryption can help you comply with regulatory and legislative requirements such as those found in the Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 (FISMA), the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA), and other government and industry regulations.
segment.target: Using encryption can help you comply with regulatory and legislative requirements such as those found in the Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 (FISMA), the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA), and other government and industry regulations.

segment.source: By creating connection security rules that apply to devices that host and exchange sensitive data, you can help protect the confidentiality of that data by encrypting it.
segment.target: By creating connection security rules that apply to devices that host and exchange sensitive data, you can help protect the confidentiality of that data by encrypting it.

segment.source: The following illustration shows an encryption zone in an isolated domain.
segment.target: The following illustration shows an encryption zone in an isolated domain.

segment.source: The rules that implement both the isolated domain and the different zones are deployed by using Group Policy and Active Directory.
segment.target: The rules that implement both the isolated domain and the different zones are deployed by using Group Policy and Active Directory.

segment.source: encryption zone in an isolated domain
segment.target: encryption zone in an isolated domain

segment.source: This goal provides the following benefits:
segment.target: This goal provides the following benefits:

segment.source: Devices in the encryption zone require authentication to communicate with other devices.
segment.target: Devices in the encryption zone require authentication to communicate with other devices.

segment.source: This works no differently from the domain isolation goal and design.
segment.target: This works no differently from the domain isolation goal and design.

segment.source: For more info, see Restrict Access to Only Trusted Devices.
segment.target: For more info, see Restrict Access to Only Trusted Devices.

segment.source: Devices in the encryption zone require that all inbound and outbound network traffic be encrypted.
segment.target: Devices in the encryption zone require that all inbound and outbound network traffic be encrypted.

segment.source: For example, Woodgrove Bank processes sensitive customer data on a device that must be protected from eavesdropping by devices on the network.
segment.target: For example, Woodgrove Bank processes sensitive customer data on a device that must be protected from eavesdropping by devices on the network.

segment.source: Connection security rules specify that all traffic must be encrypted by a sufficiently complex encryption algorithm to help protect the data.
segment.target: Connection security rules specify that all traffic must be encrypted by a sufficiently complex encryption algorithm to help protect the data.

segment.source: Devices in the encryption zone are often good candidates for server isolation, where access is limited to only computer accounts and user accounts that are members of an authorized access group.
segment.target: Devices in the encryption zone are often good candidates for server isolation, where access is limited to only computer accounts and user accounts that are members of an authorized access group.

segment.source: In many organizations, the encryption zone and the server isolation zone are one and the same.
segment.target: In many organizations, the encryption zone and the server isolation zone are one and the same.

segment.source: For more info, see Restrict Access to Only Specified Users or Devices.
segment.target: For more info, see Restrict Access to Only Specified Users or Devices.

segment.source: The following components are required for this deployment goal:
segment.target: The following components are required for this deployment goal:

segment.source: Active Directory: Active Directory supports centralized management of connection security rules by configuring the rules in one or more GPOs that can be automatically applied to all relevant devices in the domain.
segment.target: Active Directory: Active Directory supports centralized management of connection security rules by configuring the rules in one or more GPOs that can be automatically applied to all relevant devices in the domain.

source.pc: Restrict Access to Only Specified Users or Devices

target.pc: Restrict Access to Only Specified Users or Devices
